content: The **Ubin–Khatib Important Bird Area**, also known as the **North-East Conservation Area** , is an 8940 ha tract of largely undeveloped land in north-eastern [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) on the border with the [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysia) state of [Johor](/wiki/Johor). It encompasses the island of [Ubin](/wiki/Pulau_Ubin) and much of the islands of [Tekong](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong) and [Tekong Kechil](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong_Kechil), as well as a coastal strip of the main island, including the [Lower Seletar Reservoir](/wiki/Lower_Seletar_Reservoir), with the intervening coastal waters, [seagrass](/wiki/Seagrass) beds, [mangroves](/wiki/Mangrove) and intertidal [mudflats](/wiki/Mudflat). ## Birds The site has been identified as an [Important Bird Area](/wiki/Important_Bird_Area) (IBA) by [BirdLife International](/wiki/BirdLife_International) because it supports significant numbers of visiting and resident birds, some of which are [threatened](/wiki/Threatened_species). These include [vulnerable](/wiki/Vulnerable_species) [Chinese egrets](/wiki/Chinese_egret), [greater spotted eagles](/wiki/Greater_spotted_eagle) and [straw-headed bulbuls](/wiki/Straw-headed_bulbul), [endangered](/wiki/Endangered_species) [Nordmann's greenshanks](/wiki/Nordmann%27s_greenshank) and [critically endangered](/wiki/Critically_endangered) [spoon-billed sandpipers](/wiki/Spoon-billed_sandpiper), as well as [greater crested terns](/wiki/Greater_crested_tern). 01°25′N 103°58′E﻿ / ﻿1.417°N 103.967°E﻿ / 1.417; 103.967 This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Ubin–Khatib Important Bird Area
